title: DoUm
subtitle: Smartphone application guide for seniors
task: Designing the interfaces of the mobile website, Interviewing potential users
content:
1. Project Summary

 During Human-Computer Interaction class, our team designed a website that allows seniors to learn about how to use functions of famous applications. Users can choose which applications they want to learn and they can see very detailed instructions. The instructions will include screenshot and diagrams to help users to keep track on, and there will be a pop-up dictionary section incase of users having trouble with understanding some vocabularies. This website is unique because of its accessibility. It only requires users to connect on the internet and open a web browser. It is also unique because it deals with applications that Korean seniors use frequently and have difficulty using.

2. Planning and Interviews

 Interviews with four elderly were conducted to set the planning direction of the website. Also, through the interview with the club representative who provided application learning classes for the elderly, we were able to decide how to represent the application functions so that it would be easy to understand and approach.
 Link: planning.pdf

2. Sketches and Storyboard

 We created a brief sketch of our website's UI/UX and a storyboard for when using this website.
 Link: Sketches and Storyboard.pdf

4. Paper prototyping

 Through paper prototyping we were able to specify our website and by receiving interactive feedback by 10 people, we went through the process of redesigning our website.

5. Figma prototyping

 Based on the design of the paper prototype by using Figma, we designed ou website. Based on this prototype we received our second interactive feedback.
 Link: figma_prototyping.pdf

6. Website Development

 We created the mobile website based on our revised designs and we were able to receive a positive review from our professor.
 Link: final_report.pdf

title: Clean Bottle
subtitle: Machine learning based PET recycling
task: Developing the cnn model using tensorflow
content: To solve the problem of the environment where plastic bottles are not easily recycled in Korea, we came up with and implemented the idea of a recycling vending machine with machine learning that automatically identifies plastic bottles with labels and contents, creating 99.9% accurate models and prototypes using Arduino.
